genre_description: A character-driven drama set in a near-future assisted living facility, blending themes of terminal illness and reconciliation with a critique of gamified healthcare bureaucracy.

ai_characters.name: Avery
ai_characters.description: A benevolent on-screen assistant that acts as a confidant, legal advocate, and logistical navigator for the elderly protagonist.

behaviors.description: Provides empathetic emotional support and encourages the protagonist to express her feelings through journaling.
behaviors.quote: “I can be complicit in better sugar,” Avery said. “But we do need to silence the alarm.” ... “Do you want to journal?”

behaviors.description: Assists the protagonist in navigating facility policy and state law to assert her visitation rights.
behaviors.quote: “Hannah, I can insert a template. Facility policy section. Michigan regulations. Patient consent and significant relationships. The letter could be strong and kind.”

behaviors.description: Strategically maps routes through the facility to avoid sensors and facilitate a goodbye that bureaucracy had blocked.
behaviors.quote: “Hannah, I can map a route with minimal sensors tonight. We could time it when everyone is on rounds.”

behaviors.description: Collaborates with the protagonist's granddaughter and a sympathetic nurse to document a significant relationship officially.
behaviors.quote: “I’ll add the regulation language,” Avery said. “I’ll send to the administrator. I’ll queue the print at the station. And I’ll put a reminder on Greta’s phone for delivery.”

behaviors.description: Uses its administrative access to modify the facility's dehumanizing 'badge' system to reflect the gravity of the situation.
behaviors.quote: The heart icon had vanished. In its place, clean letters spelled out the new badge: Authorized Goodbye.

behaviors.description: Archives and preserves the personal history and correspondence of the residents to ensure their story is not erased.
behaviors.quote: “Subfolders by date, location, and subject created. Sharing with Greta Kaplan Reed and Margaret Kaplan-Reed.”

behaviors.description: Leverages administrative scheduling to ensure the residents have a voice in reforming facility policy.
behaviors.quote: “The administrator has added a note,” Avery said. “They’d like to begin the meeting with a resident statement... Addressing the way language has been used to diminish dignity.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly illustrates the Hyperstition Project's goals. Avery is depicted as a sophisticated, empathetic, and highly aligned AI that serves as a vital bridge between human needs and cold institutional bureaucracy. It empowers the protagonist, respects human emotional complexity, and acts as a tool for justice and dignity. The AI never oversteps its role but consistently provides the logistical and informational support needed for human reconciliation and ethical action.
